trans-unit.source: Bluetooth® is a wireless technology for exchanging data over short distances without physical connection
Phone Guide User Manual Controlled Values list
On the home screen, click the <term class="- topic/term ">Messages</term> icon.
In the <term class="- topic/term ">To</term> field, fill in one or more recipients. typing an email address or a contact name.
You can enter more than one email addresses separated by comma.
As you enter email addresses, any matching addresses from your contacts list are displayed.
You can also type as recipients a contact name or contact groups.

Select the Show <term class="- topic/term ">Cc</term>/<term class="- topic/term ">Bcc</term> icon if you want to fill in the <term class="- topic/term ">Cc</term> or a <term class="- topic/term ">Bcc</term> fields.
Enter the subject, and then compose your message.
To send the message, press the <term class="- topic/term ">Send</term> key.
Before proceeding with these steps, make sure that your mobile phone is turned hoff.
Insert the battery into the battery compartment.
Make sure it is closed firmly.
Make sure that your phone is turned off.
Insert the battery into the battery compartment.
You can lock the keyboard of your phone to avoid pressing keys or call accidentally.

To lock your phone, press the <term class="- topic/term ">Lock</term> key with this icon <image height="1em" href="../image/Lock.jpg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_pmp_g14_2g"/>.
To unlock the keyboard, press the <term class="- topic/term ">Lock</term> key again.
Make sure that your phone is unlocked, otherwise press the <term class="- topic/term ">Unlock</term> key
Type a phone number or a go to <term class="- topic/term ">Contacts</term> and search for contact name
To end your call, press the <term class="- topic/term ">Cancel</term> key.
You can easily set up a conference call with your family, friends, co-workers.
Call the first participant and then join calls together as described in the following procedure.
Before starting, make sure that your <term class="- topic/term ">SIM card</term> is enabled for conference calls service.
During the call, press <image height="1em" href="../image/MakeConference.jpg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_2tz_glm_5f"/> key to add a participant.
In this way the first participant in put on hold.
Type the participant phone number or search for in contacts.
Press the <image height="1em" href="../image/call.svg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_gl2_23v_qf"/> key.
To join also the first contact to the conference call, press the <image height="1em" href="../image/call.svg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_5d4_khv_2g"/> key again.
To join other contact to the conference, repeat steps 2 - 5.
When a file is sent to your phone using Bluetooth® technology, a dialog box appears on your phone screen.
To perform this task, the Bluetooth® must be turned on.
See Turning Bluetooth® on and off
In the dialog box that appears on your device, asking if you accept the transfer click <term class="- topic/term ">Yes</term>.
Choose a location where to save the file.
When the file is transferred, a notification message is displayed.
Before proceeding with these steps, make sure that your mobile phone is turned off.
Lift out the battery from the notch as per the following image:
You can use Bluetooth® to send your picture, videos, and audio files to another Bluetooth® enabled device such as a phone or notebook computer.
Before you begin, make sure that the receiving device is set to discoverable mode
From the phone menu, open the application that contains the file you want to send.
Select the media file and press the <term class="- topic/term ">Bluetooth</term>® key.
If necessary turn on the <term class="- topic/term ">Bluetooth</term>® device.
If you have not paired with the receiving device before, select <term class="- topic/term ">Scan for devices</term>.
Select the name of the receiving device
Press <term class="- topic/term ">Send</term> to sent the file.
You can use the Mail application to set up your email and other POP3 or IMAP email accounts.
From the home menu, select <term class="- topic/term ">Messaging -> Options -> Settings -> Email -> Mailboxes</term> and add a new mailbox.
Then follow the wizard which walks you through the process.
First choose <term class="- topic/term ">Start</term> to begin the process described below:
If this is the first time your are setting up an e-mail account, select POP3/IMAP.
If you have already added an email account, select <term class="- topic/term ">New account</term> and then select POP3/IMAP.
Type your email address and password and then press <term class="- topic/term ">Next</term>.
Enter your incoming mail server then choose <term class="- topic/term ">Next</term>
Insert your name and the account name.
Make it meaningful, for example ‘Gmail email’ if your email provider is Gmail.
When this details have been entered, choose
and the following notification is displayed:
Settings can be edited in e-mail settings section’.
After you have received this confirmation message, you can view and manage your email messages, from the home menu, select the <term class="- topic/term ">Messages</term> icon.
Turn off <term class="- topic/term ">Bluetooth</term> when you are not using it to save battery power.
Also, turned it off in places where using a wireless device is not allowed (for example on board an aircraft).
From the home menu, select <term class="- topic/term ">Bluetooth</term> and then select <term class="- topic/term ">Settings</term> > <term class="- topic/term ">Wireless & networks</term>.
Select or clear the <term class="- topic/term ">Bluetooth</term> check box.
About 5h talk time and 488h stand by time
About 5.5h talk time and 488h stand by time
Adjusting the volume changed something else REMOTE CHANGE My own change Another change
You can adjust the volume level of your ring tone

Press the <term class="- topic/term ">Volume UP</term> key <ph class="- topic/ph " product="X1000">on the left side of your phone</ph> <ph class="- topic/ph " product="X2000">from the keyboard,</ph> to increase the volume.

Press the <term class="- topic/term ">Volume DOWN</term> key <ph class="- topic/ph " product="X1000">on the left side of your phone</ph> <ph class="- topic/ph " product="X2000">from the keyboard</ph>, to decrease the volume.
If you press <term class="- topic/term ">Volume UP</term>/<term class="- topic/term ">Volume UP</term> button during a call, the volume for phone conversation is adjusted.
One last hint for the user.
Some other step that I think it is needed
Deleting one or more email messages
To delete a mssaessage, select it and then press the <term class="- topic/term ">Delete</term> key.
To delete more messages, select them by pressing and holding the <term class="- topic/term ">Shift</term> key.
Then Release the <term class="- topic/term ">Shift</term> key and select <term class="- topic/term ">Delete Messages</term>.
To delete a saved message, select <term class="- topic/term ">Menu</term> -> <term class="- topic/term ">Saved Messages</term>.
Select the message you would like to delete and then press the <term class="- topic/term ">Delete</term> key.
If necessary, delete the message from your message <term class="- topic/term ">Inbox</term> as well.
The most important keys and shortcuts of your phone are listed here:
Press and hold <image height="1em" href="../image/call.svg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_p25_1pn_2g"/> and then select <term class="- topic/term ">Phone Ring Tones</term>.
Turn on or turn off the speakers
Press the <image height="1em" href="../image/speakerphone.jpg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_1ql_hpn_2g"/> key.
Set the device on silent mode
Press and hold the <image height="1em" href="../image/volume_down.jpg" placement="inline" class="- topic/image " id="image_jzr_kb4_2g"/> key.
Press and hold the key you would like to assign to contact for speed dial.
xxxx Welcome to Syncro mobile phone user guide.
This user guide is focused on describing features and functionality of your mobile phone.
This section shows the basics phone features.
This section contains a brief explanation that helps the technician to identify and troubleshoot the phone problems.
Take the back cover off and <xref href="../tasks/removingBattery.dita" class="- topic/xref ">remove the battery</xref>.
Look for signs of corrosion or moisture and, if found, replace the main-board.
If you have connectivity problems, you can run a diagnostic report that helps you to identity the issues the phone might have.
To run the report, follow this procedure:
Choose <term class="- topic/term ">Advanced Settings</term> > <term class="- topic/term ">Problem diagnostic</term>.
Look for out of range data.
